title: Anakaputhur, a former weavers‚Äô colony, now on the verge of development
content: The famous Real Madras Handkerchief, Bleeding Madras and Madras Checks came from the handlooms of this village near Pallavaram

title: India has world‚Äôs highest number of slum clusters in flood-prone areas
content: A new study has found that more than 158 million slum-dwellers in India live in vulnerable settlements in floodplains, with most of them concentrated in the Ganga river delta

title: Magnitude 6.5 earthquake hits Nicobar Islands, no tsunami alert
content: The quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometres at 12 minutes past midnight local time, 259 kilometers west-northwest of Sabang, in western Indonesia‚Äôs Aceh

content: Chief Minister also stressed that the committee must work on minute details like studying the carrying capacity of the shrines and even nearby areas

title: Beed sarpanch murder case: Court rejects Walmik Karad‚Äôs discharge plea
content: The prosecution in the court argued that accused Walmik Karad conspired with co-accused persons, demanding a ransom of ‚Çπ2 crores from the officials of the company Avaada Energy Private Ltd

title: NSCN faction says Assam eviction drive planned to grab Naga ancestral lands
content: The outfit says the areas targeted were fictitiously marked ‚Äòdisturbed area belt‚Äô, citing demarcations by the British, who transferred these areas for administrative convenience

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) delegation meets Governor, demands removal of ‚Äòcorrupt‚Äô Ministers
content: The delegation submitted a memorandum to the governor, underlining several incidents of misconduct by Ministers in the State Cabinet and provided evidence

title: Ceasefire between India and Pakistan had no linkage with U.S. trade: Jaishankar in Parliament
content: There was no call between the Prime Minister and President Trump from April 22 ‚Äì when President Trump called up to convey his sympathy ‚Äì and June 17, says Jaishankar

title: DMK has failed in its duty and surrendered to the BJP: Vijay
content: He says the Centre has sidelined Tamil Nadu, but now Prime Minister Narendra Modi is announcing statues for Chola kings and ‚Äútaking lessons‚Äù from the Chola dynasty

title: Mamata asks migrants harassed in other States to return to West Bengal
content: Earlier in the day, during an administrative meeting West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee proposed to include migrant workers who returned to the state after 100 days of work under MGNREGA

title: Set for a record: paddy procurement in Tamil Nadu likely to touch 45-lakh-tonne mark soon
content: As of now, 44.49 lakh tonnes have been procured. With the State procuring an average of about 15,000 tonnes from farmers on a daily basis, the current high of 44.95 lakh tonnes, collected in 2020-21, will be crossed in a few days

title: Yemen revokes Nimisha Priya‚Äôs death sentence, claims Kanthapuram
content: Indian official sources, however, refused to confirm the claim so far saying the case is complex as the victim‚Äôs family had not reached a consensus on pardoning Nimisha Priya

title: Bus fare subsidy helps women save 30-50% on transport costs, increase edu spending: Study
content: The report revealed that in cities such as Nagpur and Pune, where fare subsidies apply primarily to intercity or long-distance routes, average monthly savings range from ‚Çπ409 to ‚Çπ538

title: Farmers in Punjab stage demonstration under KMM banner against Govt‚Äôs land pooling policy; Akali Dal also protests
content: Shiromani Akali Dal members staged a protest rally in Mohali against the land pooling policy. The party announced to hold another demonstration rally in Bathinda on August 4

title: Nuns are innocent, say family members of tribal women
content: Arrest of Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh trigger protests; siblings of the purported victims reject allegations of trafficking and forcible conversion; they say the tribal women were accompanying the nuns to Agra for a job with the consent of family members; Chhattisgarh Chief Minister defends arrest

title: CS instructs officials not to appoint teachers to revise voters‚Äô list
content: Shalini Rajneesh has instructed officials to appoint non-teaching staff, officers, and staff members working in various departments on priority basis for the task of revising the voters‚Äô list

title: India, Japan officials meet, discuss PM‚Äôs visit, bullet train project
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is expected to visit India for the Quad Summit, along with U.S. President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, later this year

title: 4 Killed In Shooting At Manhattan Office Building, Suspect Dead
content: At least four people were reportedly killed, including a New York Police Department officer, in a shooting in New York's central Manhattan on Monday (local time).

title: Trump-Kim Jong Un Ties "Not Bad", US Must Accept New Nuke Reality: North Korea
content: -North Korea said on Tuesday the United States must accept that reality has changed since the countries' summit meetings in the past, and no future dialogue would end its nuclear programme, state media KCNA reported.

title: IT Employee Hacked To Death In Suspected Honour Killing In Tamil Nadu: Cops
content: An IT employee belonging to the Scheduled Caste was hacked to death by a youth, allegedly over an inter-caste relationship, police said on Monday.

title: Assam To Clear 10,000 Bighas Of Encroached Land Amid Mega Eviction Drive
content: The Himanta Biswa Sarma-led government is now planning to launch a massive eviction drive in upper Assam's Golaghat. The move will clear 10,000 bighas (approximately 3,300 acres) of land in the Rengma Reserve forest at Uriamghat, bordering Nagaland.

title: 2 People Shot At Manhattan Office Building In New York City, Suspect Dead
content: Police swarmed Midtown Manhattan on Monday as the mayor of New York City said there was "an active shooter investigation" amid reports a police officer had been struck.

title: Trump Calls London Mayor "Nasty Person", Says "He's Done Terrible Job"
content: US President Donald Trump attacked London's Mayor Sadiq Khan once again at a news conference in Scotland alongside British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, who interjected that Khan was his "friend".

title: 3 Killed, Several Injured In Shooting At US' Nevada Casino: Cops
content: A gunman opened fire Monday outside the largest casino in Reno, Nevada, killing three people and wounding three others before being taken into custody, officials said.

title: At UN, Palestinian PM Urges Hamas To Surrender Control Of Gaza, Disarm
content: Palestinian prime minister Mohammad Mustafa said Monday that Hamas must disarm and give up control of Gaza to the Palestinian Authority to restore security in the war-torn territory.

title: "No Alternative" To Two-State Solution For Israel, Palestinians: France
content: There is no alternative to a two-state solution between Israelis and the Palestinians, France told a UN conference co-chaired with Saudi Arabia Monday that was boycotted by Israel and branded a stunt by Washington.

title: "Nitish Kumar Will Take Oath As CM": Chirag Paswan's U-Turn On JDU Leader
content: Union minister and LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan on Monday said Nitish Kumar will take oath as Bihar Chief Minister again after the assembly elections to be held later this year.

title: PM Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah To Address Lok Sabha Today
content: As the Parliament continues its discussion on Operation Sindoor, Union Home Minister Amit Shah will address the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to deliver his speech in the evening.

title: Iran Vows Stronger Response If Attacked Again By US, Israel
content: Iran's foreign minister warned on Monday that it would respond to the United States and Israel in a "more decisive manner" should they attack Iran again.

title: Judge blocks Trump administration's efforts to defund Planned Parenthood
content: A federal judge ruled Planned Parenthood clinics nationwide must continue to be reimbursed for Medicaid funding as the nation's largest abortion provider fights  Trump's administration over efforts to defund the organization in his tax legislation

title: Trump Says Gaza Ceasefire 'Possible' Amid Starmer Talks
content: Donald Trump said a ceasefire in Gaza was "possible", and stepped up warnings to Russia, as he met UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer at one of the US president's Scottish golf resorts on Monday.

title: 4 Girl Students In Hospital. They Were Made To Do 200 Sit-Ups For Being Late
content: Four students were admitted to a hospital in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum on Monday as they collapsed after allegedly being made to do 200 sit-ups for reaching school late, according to their families.

title: "Appeal In Disguise": Tamil Nadu To Top Court On Presidential Reference On Governor's Powers
content: The Tamil Nadu government has urged the Supreme Court to declare the Presidential Reference on the powers and timelines for Governors and the President to act on state bills as "not maintainable".

title: US Plan To Destroy Women's Contraception Products Worth Millions Sparks Uproar
content: The US administration's decision to destroy nearly $10 million worth of women's contraception products has sparked furious condemnation from doctors and aid groups, who have slammed the move as a wasteful attack on women's rights.

title: US Plan To Destroy Women's Contraception Products Worth Millions Sparks Uproar
content: The US administration's decision to destroy nearly $10 million worth of women's contraception products has sparked furious condemnation from doctors and aid groups, who have slammed the move as a wasteful attack on women's rights.

title: "Jhalawar School Tragedy Heart-Wrenching": Rajasthan High Court
content: The Rajasthan High Court has taken suo motu cognisance of the tragic school building collapse in Jhalawar, calling the incident "heart-wrenching."

title: Phone-Tapping Rampant Under Revanth Reddy, Alleges Opposition Leader
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi leader and former IPS officer RS Praveen Kumar has lodged a formal complaint with the police levelling serious allegations against Telangana's Congress government.

title: State sees a fall in seroprevalence of Hepatitis B, says nodal officer
content: World Hepatitis Day is observed on July 28 to raise awareness on the liver infection caused by five types of viruses A, B, C, D and E; sex workers, drug users and those who get tattoos are generally considered to be at higher risk

title: Centre should abandon security-centric approach, engage in dialogue to resolve J&K issues: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Speaking at the PDP‚Äôs 26th¬†foundation day event, she says Centre should restore trust of the people by engaging in a process that respects their dignity and rights

title: Google officials depose before ED in online betting linked PMLA case
content: The agency may also record the statement of a designated "compliance officer" of Google under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) apart from obtaining some documents from the company

title: Nuns to stay, serve in Gaza despite attacks, says Missionaries of Charity
content: The Missionaries of Charity has served in multiple conflict zones in the world, including in Gaza; the organisation said that the nuns ‚Äúhave been there from the beginning of the conflict‚Äù

title: Only by acknowledging diversity can India progress, says D. Raja
content: Releasing the book Kaalamthorum Communists, he urges communists to work closely with Periyarists and Ambedkarists to liberate people from exploitation and inequality

title: LJP(RV) will continue in the NDA, says senior party leader and MP Arun Bharti
content: Mr. Bharti‚Äôs remarks come in the backdrop of party President Chirag Paswan‚Äôs critical comments against the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar

content: BJP member Baijant Panda claims Mr. Tharoor was not allowed to speak by his party as he spoke in ‚Äúnational interest‚Äù

content: The query came after senior advocate Kapil Sibal complained that the action taken by the Supreme Court at the time, including release of sensitive visual and audio materials showing ‚Äòburnt currency‚Äô, ‚Äúconvicted‚Äù Justice Varma in the public eye

title: Private defence suppliers seek review of rules limiting ammunition procurement to public sector
content: A private defence manufacturer says if the MoD amends the existing rule to allow for open Request For Proposal to be issued to both public and private sector, it will provide a big boost to the private ammunition industry

title: Procedure to redress chemically contaminated sites gets legal teeth
content: The new rules are part of a process of ‚Äúlegally codifying‚Äù the process in place once contaminated sites were identified; under these rules, the district administration would prepare half-yearly reports on ‚Äúsuspected contaminated sites‚Äù

title: BRS, Sigachi victims‚Äô kin flay delay in handing over bodies, ex-gratia
content: Harish Rao asks why details of total deaths, injured persons not announced even after a month of the mishap

title: Congress raises questions on security lapses which led to Pahalgam attack

title:
Will Modi speak in North India about¬†
Rajendra Chola‚Äôs victorious expedition, asks¬† TNCC chief Selvaperunthagai
content: The¬†TNCC president dares Mr. Modi to speak about installing a statue for¬†Rajendra Chola in North India and the defeat he had meted out to¬†the north Indian armies during his expedition¬†

title: BJP MPs protest against Muslim cleric‚Äôs remarks on Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav
content: Maulana‚ÄØSajid‚ÄØRashidi, the cleric, had criticised Ms. Yadav, wife of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, for visiting a mosque near the Parliament without covering her head

content: DA arrears, unemployment and lack of jobs trigger fresh unrest in State; heavy police deployment fails to deter marchers¬†

content: Last month, the court had said that it had been a considerable time since the incident and yet no chargesheet had been filed in the case in which six persons were abducted and later found dead

title: Gujarat tops July rankings in Centre‚Äôs PM-JANMAN tribal mission
content: The western State is home to five Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups ‚Äî Kathodi, Kotwalia, Padhar, Siddi, and Kolgha; the government is focused on addressing development gaps through targeted delivery, said officials

title: Six-year-old killed, two injured in school gate collapse in Jaisalmer
content: The concrete structure of the main gate had weakened after a vehicle hit it sometime ago; it collapsed under the impact of strong winds

title: ASHAs urge Kerala govt. to keep its promise by increasing honorarium
content: The strike by a section of ASHA workers in the State, demanding a hike in honorarium as well as a better pay package, has crossed 170 days.

title: Notices to 3.75 lakh property tax defaulters
content: As of January, 2025, 2.06 lakh property owners were still defaulters and their arrears added to ‚Çπ329.15 Crore

title: M.R. Ajith Kumar appointed Excise Commissioner
content: The decision comes in the wake of a controversy over Ajith Kumar using a tractor to travel in Sabarimala, an act disapproved by the Kerala High Court

title: Cubs Hall of Famer Sandberg dies at age 65
content: Ryne Sandberg, the Hall of Fame second baseman who spent nearly all of his playing career with the Cubs, has died at the age of 65.

title: Report: 5 killed at NYC building housing NFL HQ
content: A shooting Monday at a midtown Manhattan office building that houses the NFL offices and some of the country's top financial firms left at least five people dead, including an off-duty New York City police officer, sources told the The Associated Press.

title: 'It was a no-brainer': Paul celebrated in L.A. return
content: Eight years after he last played for the franchise, Chris Paul was re-introduced as a member of the Clippers on Monday, calling his return to Los Angeles a "no-brainer."

title: D-backs 3B Su√°rez hit on hand, X-rays negative
content: D-backs All-Star Eugenio Su√°rez hopes he avoided major injury when he was hit in the right index finger by a pitch on Monday.

title: Deion says he's cancer-free after bladder removal
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Dallas' Guyton (knee) out, but ACL intact
content: An MRI revealed that Cowboys left tackle Tyler Guyton suffered a bone fracture -- not a torn ACL -- in his right knee during Monday's practice. He will sit out four to six weeks, but the injury will not require surgery.

title: üëÄ Messi and wife caught on Coldplay 'kiss cam'
content: Lionel Messi attended the Coldplay concert on Sunday night at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami with his family.

content: Ashton Jeanty started turning heads as a 14-year-old in Naples, Italy. His coaches, teammates and even his opponents have been witnesses to his rise.

content: The star couple drew crowds in the upstate New York lake town on a short vacation celebrating Gardner becoming the highest-paid cornerback in NFL history.

content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: P√©rez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo P√©rez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Refreshed as Manchester United begin their U.S. preseason tour, Ruben Amorim finally has the time to implement the changes he feels will turn the club around.

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: Late heroics, Reggie the dog and a new team mantra. Here's the inside story of how England won the 2025 European Championship.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Manhattan: Five people, including a police officer, killed in shooting incident; suspect neutralised
content: A major shooting in Midtown Manhattan on Monday evening left an NYPD officer and two civilians wounded. A lone gunman opened fire near a corporate building on Park Avenue before being neutralised. The shooter is believed to be dead. One civilian is in critical condition, while the officer and another civilian are expected to survive.

title: NEP@5: More learners, more women, more languages - But can it deliver on its full promise?
content: India's National Education Policy 2020 is showing promising early results, particularly in foundational learning for primary students, where reading and arithmetic skills have seen significant gains, especially in rural areas. Higher education is also experiencing growth, with increased enrollment across various demographics, including women and marginalized communities. However, the policy faces implementation challenges and political resistance, hindering the widespread adoption of some reforms.

title: Terrorist who led Pahalgam attack killed in J&K gunfight
content: Indian Army para commandos neutralized Suleiman, the lead perpetrator of the Pahalgam massacre where 26 civilians were killed. The operation, named 'Mahadev', took place in the Dachigam forest area near Srinagar, resulting in the deaths of two more Pakistani terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba. Suleiman, a former Pakistani special forces commando, was also involved in the 2023 Poonch attack on an Army truck.

title: 'This plea shouldn‚Äôt have been filed': SC to Varma
content: The Supreme Court questioned Justice Yashwant Varma's petition challenging the in-house inquiry into the discovery of currency at his residence, noting his participation in the process. The court highlighted that the inquiry report wouldn't be binding on the Lok Sabha's inquiry panel. Additionally, the bench addressed a plea for an FIR against Justice Varma, requesting the inquiry report for review.

title: Amid Bihar‚Äôs SIR drive, dog gets residence certificate; oppn roasts EC, Nitish govt
content: In Bihar, a residence certificate was fraudulently issued to a dog named 'Dog Babu,' raising concerns about the integrity of the state's e-governance systems during the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The incident, involving misused Aadhaar details, has sparked outrage from the opposition, who allege widespread irregularities in the voter roll revision process. Officials are facing action for negligence in verifying the application.

title: Ex-Google AI engineer shares his experience after joining Microsoft: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm already ‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Amar Subramanya, previously at Google, has joined Microsoft as Corporate VP of AI. He appreciates Microsoft's collaborative and ambitious culture. Subramanya highlights the company's focus on AI foundation models and Microsoft Copilot. Other DeepMind team members have also reportedly joined Microsoft. This hiring trend reflects the competitive AI landscape. Microsoft's leadership is committed to advancing AI technology.

title: In LS, Rajnath, Jaishankar reject Trump mediation claim as Cong's Gogoi flags it
content: In Lok Sabha, the government refuted opposition claims that Operation Sindoor was halted due to US pressure, as alleged by President Trump. Rajnath Singh and S Jaishankar clarified that Pakistan initiated the truce after India achieved its objectives. They emphasized that trade was never linked to the operation in discussions with the US, dismissing the allegations as baseless.

title: ‚ÄòSaiyaara': Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda starrer inches closer to Rs 260 crore in India despite a drop
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara' continues its strong box office performance into its second week, earning ‚Çπ9.50 crore on Monday, bringing its total to ‚Çπ256.75 crore in India. Despite a weekday dip, the film has outperformed major Bollywood releases like 'Dunki' and 'Singham Again'.

title: Chinese company banned in America launches rival to Nvidia‚Äôs most-advanced chip
content: Huawei's CloudMatrix 384, showcased at WAIC Shanghai, is emerging as a strong competitor to Nvidia's GB200 NVL72. Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is becoming a key Chinese AI chip supplier. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged Huawei's progress and warned about the impact of U.S. curbs, suggesting Huawei could dominate if restrictions persist.

title: Maharashtra bars staff from online criticism of government
content: The Maharashtra government has issued guidelines restricting state employees' social media use, prohibiting criticism of current or future government policies. Employees are barred from sharing confidential documents without approval and must avoid banned websites and apps. Violations will result in disciplinary action under the Maharashtra Civil Services Rules, emphasizing responsible online conduct and separation of personal and official accounts.

title: Atlanta inventor Julian Brown 'missing' for two weeks; his last post triggers suspense
content: Julian Brown, a young inventor from Atlanta, has reportedly disappeared after posting a message about being under attack. Brown is known for 'Plastoline,' a plastic-to-fuel technology. His last social media post hinted at trouble. Social media users expressed concerns about his safety and urged the FBI to investigate. His followers claim that something bad happened to him as he did not post on social media after July 9.

title: China's BYD to assemble EVs in Pakistan; VP BYD Pakistan says, 'Do not forsee...'
content: BYD is planning to launch its first Pakistan-assembled car by July or August 2026, aiming to capitalize on the growing demand for electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles. The plant, a joint venture with Mega Motor Company, will initially produce 25,000 units annually, focusing on the domestic market with potential exports to right-hand drive countries.

title: SIR in Bihar: Accept Aadhaar along with voter ID, SC tells EC
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar and EPIC for voter authentication during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that the SIR should focus on broad inclusion rather than exclusion. While rejecting a stay on the SIR, the court agreed to daily hearings for a swift resolution.

title: From September 2, US visa interview waiver only in special cases
content: The US has tightened its non-immigrant visa norms, requiring in-person interviews for most applicants, including those under 14 and over 79, starting September 2nd. Exceptions exist for B-1, B-2, B1/B2 visa renewals within 12 months of expiration, provided certain criteria are met. Consular officers retain the right to mandate interviews on a case-by-case basis, impacting wait times which vary across Indian cities.

title: Tom Brady backs son‚Äôs hoop dreams: Hints Michigan recruitment after viral dunk video
content: Tom Brady, now retired, is proudly showcasing his children's talents, particularly his son Benjamin's basketball skills, even hinting at a future Wolverine. While Benjamin explores both football and his artistic side, Brady's eldest, Jack, is also making his mark in sports, strengthening their bond. Brady embraces his children's diverse interests, supporting their individual paths.

title: Rajnath Singh: Operation Sindoor achieved objective, was then 'paused'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh defended Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, stating its objective was to punish Pakistan for proxy terrorism by eliminating terror nurseries, and it was paused after achieving desired results, not due to US pressure. The opposition criticized the government for halting the operation and demanded accountability for security lapses in Pahalgam and clarification on downed Indian jets, questioning the operation's success and the delay in reclaiming PoK.

title: Killing of terrorist who led Pahalgam strike blunts opposition's attack in House
content: Just before the Operation Sindoor debate, the killing of three alleged terrorists near Srinagar, including Suleiman, the suspected mastermind of the Pahalgam massacre, seemingly deflated the opposition's planned criticism of the government's counterterrorism efforts. Despite this development, SP's Ramashankar Rajbhar questioned the delay in arresting those responsible for the Pahalgam attack, even as BJP's Baijyant Panda celebrated the news of Suleiman's death during Operation Mahadev.

title: LA Lakers add Villanova‚Äôs 6-foot-8 all-time scorer to support Luka-LeBron power duo
content: Los Angeles Lakers have signed Eric Dixon, Villanova's top scorer, along with RJ Davis, Arthur Kaluma, and Augustas Marƒçiulionis. Dixon's signing was delayed due to a foot injury. He is known for his scoring ability. The Lakers aim to build depth around LeBron James and Luka Doncic. Dixon may start in the G-League.

title: At no stage of talks with US was trade tied to Sindoor, says EAM
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar defended India's global outreach following the Pahalgam attack, asserting overwhelming international support and dismissing claims of policy failure. He highlighted backing from Quad, Brics, and the UNSC, emphasizing India's right to defend against cross-border terrorism. Jaishankar also criticized past Congress actions and defended his China visit for de-escalation talks.

title: Doctor asleep, man 'bleeds to death' in Meerut hospital
content: A junior resident doctor at Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial Medical College in Meerut has been suspended following allegations of negligence. The doctor allegedly failed to attend to a 30-year-old accident victim, Sunil Kumar, who later died from his injuries while waiting for treatment. An investigation has been launched into the incident after a video surfaced showing the doctor seemingly asleep while Kumar's family pleaded for help.

title: Bengal polls: EC releases 2002 SIR data; signals rolls revision
content: The Election Commission has released the 2002 special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bengal, covering 109 assembly segments across 11 districts. This move is seen as a precursor to a new SIR rollout in the state. Simultaneously, the CEO's office is addressing complaints of false voters, summoning officials for clarification. These actions coincide with ongoing training for booth level officers.

title: Find out how many temples have governments taken over: SC to petitioner
content: A 'shebait' of Banke Bihari Ji temple contested in Supreme Court against Uttar Pradesh government's ordinance to take over the privately managed temple under the guise of development plan. The petitioner argued the state lacks legislative competence and aims to commercialize the temple, despite no mismanagement allegations. The court questioned the shebaits' management given their long-standing internal disputes.

title: Much confusion on who does what, even upkeep of drains: HC to Delhi government
content: The Delhi High Court has urged the Delhi government to streamline the management of civic services due to significant confusion among agencies, particularly regarding waterlogging issues. The court highlighted the lack of coordination between PWD and MCD in maintaining stormwater drains and sewage lines, leading to excessive flooding. It directed the chief secretary to address the matter and consider centralizing drain administration to resolve the issue of agencies passing responsibility.

title: TOI explains: How Nisar was built - why it‚Äôll take 90 days before any data comes in
content: The Nasa-Isro Synthetic Aperture Radar (Nisar) satellite is scheduled to launch on July 30 aboard the GSLV-F16 rocket from Sriharikota. Following launch, a meticulous deployment sequence will unfold over several weeks, including the deployment of a massive 12-meter radar antenna. After a 90-day commissioning phase, Nisar will commence its science operations, capturing crucial data on Earth's surface changes using its L-band and S-band frequencies.

title: Rs 16cr spent on drinking water survey in 2023 but report still under wraps
content: In 2023, the government conducted a drinking water quality survey across 485 AMRUT cities, costing ‚Çπ16.96 crore. While the findings were shared with states and UTs in a workshop and corrective measures were advised, the ministry abruptly cancelled the scheduled award ceremony for best performers just before the Lok Sabha elections, raising questions about the survey's public release.

title: Statehood demand: Congress announces August 5 as Black day in J&K
content: The Congress party in J&K has announced it will observe August 5th as a 'Black Day' to mark six years since the abrogation of Article 370 and the downgrading of the state. JKPCC president Tariq Hameed Karra stated that peaceful sit-in protests will be held on August 5th, followed by hunger strikes from August 9th to 20th, excluding August 15th and 16th.

title: No need to stay in Maha, UP or Raj, Mamata tells migrants
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has assured social security for migrant workers willing to return to the state, promising ration cards, health cards, and jobs. She directed officials to formulate a scheme for their return by train, emphasizing that Bengal will provide for its people. Banerjee also criticized the alleged persecution of Bengalis in other states and defended the skills of Bengali workers.

title: Google execs appear before ED in online betting case
content: Google officials have presented documents to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) concerning a money laundering investigation linked to betting websites and online shopping scams. Meta, also implicated, is yet to comply with the summons. The ED is scrutinizing both platforms for hosting advertisements promoting illicit betting sites and fraudulent online shopping schemes, which have allegedly defrauded Indian citizens of substantial sums.

title: Apex court lifts HC stay on West Bengal OBC list
content: The Supreme Court has overturned the Calcutta High Court's stay on West Bengal's revised OBC sub-group list, which includes 80 Muslim sub-groups. The court emphasized that the Executive branch can notify such lists without needing legislation, citing a previous nine-judge bench ruling. The High Court's stay was deemed erroneous, and the case may be reassigned to a special bench for review.

title: Fear of electrocution initially stalled rescue op at Mansa Devi temple
content: A stampede near the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar resulted in eight fatalities and numerous injuries. Initial rescue efforts were hampered by a rumour of electric current running through the fallen pilgrims, causing hesitation among bystanders. Constable Sanjay Kapoor and local shopkeepers initiated rescues, overcoming the fear.

title: Pahalgam massacre: 'Homegrown' ultras may be involved, says P Chidambaram, sparks row
content: A political firestorm has erupted over P. Chidambaram's suggestion that the Pahalgam attackers might be homegrown, sparking sharp criticism from BJP leaders. They accuse Congress of echoing Pakistan's narrative and undermining the army's efforts. Chidambaram defends his statement, claiming it was taken out of context and misrepresented by trolls seeking to spread misinformation.

title: EC has become a BJP agent to implement NRC: Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the Election Commission of acting as a "BJP agent" to implement NRC during a rally in Bolpur. She challenged the poll body to delete any genuine Bengal voter and cautioned booth level officers against harassing people, reminding them of their state government employment.

title: PM Modi can rewrite J&K‚Äôs history with dialogue: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti urged the Centre to abandon its security-centric approach and embrace dialogue, asserting PM Modi could resolve the Kashmir issue. She criticized the revocation of Article 370 for deepening alienation, not bringing peace. Defending PDP's alliance with BJP in 2015, she emphasized the party's commitment to dialogue and a peaceful J&K integrated with India through mutual respect.

title: Rajasthan school infra in focus again as 7-year-old crushed in gate collapse
content: A tragic incident in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, claimed the life of a seven-year-old boy due to the collapse of a school gate, highlighting the dire state of school infrastructure. This follows a similar incident in Jhalawar where seven children died. Public outrage is growing, with accusations of negligence and demands for accountability amidst increasing reports of unsafe school buildings across the state.

title: Government throws open IITs for students from gurukuls
content: India's education policy is undergoing a significant shift, integrating traditional knowledge systems into mainstream research. The 'Setubandha Vidwan Yojana' enables gurukul scholars without formal degrees to pursue research at IITs with generous fellowships. This initiative aims to bridge ancient wisdom with modern science, fostering interdisciplinary studies and empowering traditional scholars to contribute to national progress.

title: CBI submits report on Mahua cash-for-query case to Lokpal
content: The CBI has submitted its report to the Lokpal regarding the cash-for-query case involving MP Mahua Moitra and businessman Darshan Hiranandani. This follows an FIR registered against Moitra based on allegations of accepting cash and gifts in exchange for asking questions in Parliament. The Lokpal will now review the report to decide on further action, potentially leading to a charge sheet.

title: Deion Sanders & Karrueche Tran: Dating rumours swirl ‚Äî what we know so far
content: Deion Sanders is facing health issues. Karrueche Tran is reportedly offering support. Dating rumors are circulating online. They were spotted dining together earlier this year. Karrueche is an Emmy-winning actress. She is known for her roles in Claws and The Bay. Deion's ex-wife reposted his message. His son posted a video from the hospital.

title: Government to overhaul accreditation system, operationalise AI centre
content: To mark five years of the National Education Policy 2020, the government is set to overhaul higher education accreditation, shifting to a binary 'accredited' or 'not accredited' model. A new 'Bharatiya Bhasha' digital tool will also be launched, facilitating direct translations between Indian languages. Furthermore, the Centre of Excellence in AI in education will be operationalized.

title: UP SDM gets Rs 15L ransom message, death threat
content: Dhampur Sub-Divisional Magistrate Ritu Rani received a threatening text message. The sender demanded a ransom of fifteen lakh rupees. The sender threatened to kill her if she failed to pay. The message referenced the murder of NIA DSP Tanzeel Ahmed. Police have registered a case and are investigating. Security has been tightened for SDM Ritu Rani. The sender also shared barcodes and mobile numbers for transferring the money.

title: Udaipur Files: HC informed about re-certification application for film
content: The Delhi High Court was informed that the producers of 'Udaipur Files - Kanhaiya Lal Tailor Murder' have applied for re-certification after making six cuts and modifying the disclaimer as suggested by the Centre. The court has agreed to hear the matter on July 30, following the Supreme Court's direction to the petitioners to approach the High Court against the film's release.

title: 4 Karnataka cops suspended for stampede reinstated
content: The Karnataka government has reinstated four police officers, including the former Bengaluru City police commissioner, who were suspended following the deadly stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium in June. Disciplinary proceedings are still pending against the reinstated officers, and further action will depend on the outcome of these proceedings. However, the additional commissioner of police (west) remains suspended as his case is pending in high court.
